Description: The specific trading date for the recorded data.
The stock or index symbol. Values are ^GSPC, ^IXIC, or TSLA.
The opening price of the security for the trading day.
The highest price reached by the security during the trading day.
The lowest price reached by the security during the trading day.
The closing price of the security at the end of the trading day.

The closing price adjusted for corporate actions, including dividends and stock splits. This is the recommended price series for calculating historical returns as it provides a more accurate reflection of total equity value over time.
The total number of shares traded during the day. For indices like S&P 500 and NASDAQ, this represents the total volume of all constituent stocks.
